name: Organization Structure
description: Organizational structure and hierarchy that defines roles, responsibilities, and reporting relationships for HIPAA compliance. Requires designations of responsibility and authority levels per HIPAA Administrative Requirements.

name: Governance Framework
description: System of policies, procedures, and practices that direct and control organizational activities related to HIPAA compliance. Must include documented policies and procedures ensuring compliance with Privacy and Security regulations.

name: Privacy Office
description: Dedicated office/function responsible for overseeing privacy compliance. Manages privacy notices, authorizations, individual access requests, amendments, accounting of disclosures, and privacy incident response.

name: Security Office
description: Dedicated office/function responsible for security compliance including risk assessments, access controls, encryption, audit logging, workforce security, and security incident response.

name: Compliance Office
description: Dedicated office/function responsible for overall HIPAA compliance program management including complaint handling, audit procedures, sanctions, mitigation, and compliance monitoring.

name: Compliance Officer Role
description: Defined role responsible for compliance program development, implementation, and oversight. Reports to executive leadership with authority to implement policies and enforce sanctions.

name: Privacy Officer Role
description: Required designated privacy official responsible for development and implementation of privacy policies and procedures, privacy notices, authorization management, and fulfillment of individual rights requests.

name: Security Officer Role
description: Required designated security official responsible for development and implementation of security policies and procedures, security safeguards, risk assessments, and security incident response.

name: Incident Response Team
description: Required team and procedures for identifying and responding to security incidents. Includes detection, investigation, containment, mitigation, breach assessment, notification, and post-incident review procedures.

name: Policy Development Process
description: Required process for developing, approving, documenting, implementing, and maintaining HIPAA compliance policies and procedures. Must include version control, change management, and documentation retention.

name: Change Management Procedures
description: Required procedures for managing changes to policies, procedures, systems, or processes affecting HIPAA compliance. Must address changes in law and changes to privacy practices stated in the Notice of Privacy Practices.

name: Workforce Training Program
description: MANDATORY workforce training program. Covered Entity must train all members of its workforce on policies and procedures with respect to PHI, as necessary and appropriate for workforce members to carry out their functions. Training required at hire, for new policies, and periodically thereafter.

name: Documentation and Record Retention
description: MANDATORY documentation retention requirement. Covered Entity must retain all documentation required by Privacy and Security rules (policies, procedures, training records, complaints, sanctions, authorizations) for 6 years from date of creation or date last in effect, whichever is later.

name: Workforce Sanctions Policy
description: MANDATORY sanctions policy. Covered Entity must have and apply appropriate sanctions against members of its workforce who fail to comply with privacy and security policies, procedures, or requirements. Must document sanctions applied.

name: Mitigation Procedures
description: MANDATORY mitigation procedures. Covered Entity must mitigate, to the extent practicable, any harmful effect known to the entity of a use or disclosure of PHI in violation of policies, procedures, or requirements. Includes breach response and remediation activities.

name: Complaint Management Process
description: MANDATORY complaint process. Covered Entity must provide a process for individuals to make complaints concerning policies, procedures, or compliance. Must document all complaints received, their disposition, and provide information on filing complaints with HHS.

name: Non-Retaliation Policy
description: MANDATORY non-retaliation policy. Covered Entity may not intimidate, threaten, coerce, discriminate against, or take other retaliatory action against any individual for exercising privacy rights, filing complaints, testifying, or opposing unlawful practices.

name: Administrative Safeguards Requirement
description: MANDATORY safeguards requirement. Covered Entity must have appropriate administrative, technical, and organizational safeguards to protect privacy of PHI and prevent use or disclosure in violation of requirements.

name: Waiver of Rights Prohibition
description: MANDATORY prohibition on waiver. Covered Entity may not require individuals to waive their rights under the Privacy Rule as a condition of treatment, payment, enrollment, or eligibility for benefits.
